document_data.name: Eldan Ambrose
document_data.mainbody: '''Eldan Ambrose''' was an [[Amnian]] priest of [[Tempus]] who came to [[Battledale]] during the [[Time of Troubles]].

History.Pilgrimage to Battledale: The god Tempus came to [[Faerûn]] in a ruined castle in Battledale during the Time of Troubles in the {{yearlinkName|1358}}. Eldan and almost one-hundred of his followers rebuilt the castle, naming it the [[Abbey of the Sword]]. The Abbey of the Sword contained numerous ''[[portals]]'' in its many underground passages and entrances, and Eldan's followers took it upon themselves to guard them against intrusion.
History.Drow Invasion: In the {{yearlinkName|1371}}, [[drow]] came through an unguarded portal deep in the tunnels of the Abbey. The [[Vhaeraun]]-worshiping drow of the [[Auzkovyn Clan|Auzkovyn]] clan attacked Eldan and his followers, who fought fiercely, but ultimately lost. Eldan was devoured by a summoned [[demon]], and the drow escaped into the forest of [[Cormanthor]], opening another portal to bring more of their kin to Faerûn. The defenders of the Abbey were greatly reduced in number, and all attempts to resurrect Eldan failed. It was determined that as long as the demon that ate him still existed, Eldan could not be raised from the dead, or resurrected.
